member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions
member.summary: Options to configure HTTP client requests logging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.BodyReadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time to wait for the request or response body to be read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.BodySizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes of the request or response body to read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.LogBody
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the HTTP request and response body are logged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.LogRequestStart
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the request is logged additionally before any further processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.RequestBodyContentTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of HTTP request content types which are considered text and thus possible to serialize.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.RequestHeadersDataClasses
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of HTTP request headers to log and their respective data classes to use for redaction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.RequestPathLoggingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the outgoing HTTP request path should be logged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.RequestPathParameterRedactionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how outgoing HTTP request path parameters should be redacted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.ResponseBodyContentTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of HTTP response content types which are considered text and thus possible to serialize.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.ResponseHeadersDataClasses
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of HTTP response headers to log and their respective data classes to use for redaction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.LoggingOptions.RouteParameterDataClasses
member.summary: Gets the route parameters to redact with their corresponding data classes to apply appropriate redaction.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.OutgoingPathLoggingMode
member.summary: Strategy to decide how outgoing HTTP path is logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.OutgoingPathLoggingMode.Formatted
member.summary: HTTP path is formatted, for example in a form of /foo/bar/redactedUserId.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Logging.OutgoingPathLoggingMode.Structured
member.summary: HTTP path is not formatted, route parameters logged in curly braces, for example in a form of /foo/bar/{userId}.

member.summary: Statuses for classifying http request result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Metering.HttpRequestResultType.ExpectedFailure
member.summary: The status code of the http request indicates that the request did not succeed but has failed with an error which is expected and acceptable for this request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Metering.HttpRequestResultType.Failure
member.summary: The status code of the http request indicates that this request did not succeed and to be treated as failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Telemetry.Metering.HttpRequestResultType.Success
member.summary: The status code of the http request indicates that the request is successful.
